LegendModal Examples

Basic Usage

To create a simple modal, simply instantiate the class with a DOM element. 
        let modalOne = new LegendModal(document.getElementById('test1-div'));
        document.getElementById('test1').addEventListener('click',modalOne.showModal);

Invisible Overlay

The grey background is optional. If you want to make it invisible to the user, include an object with the option visibleOverlay: false. 
        let modalTwo = new LegendModal(document.getElementById('test2-div'),{
            visibleOverlay: false
        });
        document.getElementById('test2').addEventListener('click',modalTwo.showModal);

Manually Close the Modal

You may include a DOM element in the modal which is intended to close it. This element should have the class legend-modal-close. In this example, I use a button. 
        <button class="legend-modal-close">
            Close me!
        </button>
        let modalThree = new LegendModal();
        modalThree.setContent(document.getElementById('test3-div'));
        document.getElementById('test3').addEventListener('click',modalThree.showModal);

Limiting Close Options

If you want to strictly control how a modal is closed, you may disable the escape button and remove the close button from the upper right corner of the modal. This is best used when also providing the user a button to close the modal. 
        let modalFour = new LegendModal(null,{
            closeOnEscape: false,
            closeOnOverlayClick: false
        });
        modalFour.setContent(document.getElementById('test4-div'));
        document.getElementById('test4').addEventListener('click',modalFour.showModal);

Set Options After Instantiation

You may set the content and options of a modal after instantiating the class. This can be useful if you don't know what the content or options are when the class is created. Ex: Ajax. 
        let modalFive = new LegendModal();
        modalFive.setContent(document.getElementById('test5-div'));
        modalFive.setOptions({
            closeOnOverlayClick: true,
            closeOnEscape: false,
            visibleOverlay: true,
            showCloseButton: false
        });
        document.getElementById('test5').addEventListener('click',modalFive.showModal);
I'm just a bunch of text! You can close this modal by pressing escape, clicking the overlay, or clicking the X button in the upper right.
